SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 13th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front. Yesterday evening the enemy counter-attacked at HAVRINCOURT and MOEUVRES. His troops were seen forming up and the counter-attacks were easily repulsed.
Our troops have taken JEANCOURT and the BOIS DE HOLNON. Otherwise there is no change on the British front.
French Front.
On the ST. MIHIEL battle front, East of ST. MIHIEL the line runs from north of FEY-EN-HAYE, VIEVILLE (inclusive), THIAUCOURT (inclusive), just south of XAMMES, BENEY (exclusive), through the centre of the BOIS DE THIAUCOURT, through the south-eastern edge of the BOIS DE NONSARD, east of the BOIS DE BELLE OZIERE, BOIS DE GARGANTUA, MONTSEC (exclusive), to the original line north-west of XIVRAY.
Further west the French have taken APREMONT. On the western flank of the salient the line runs :- ST. MIHIEL (exclusive), SPADA, LAMORVILLE (exclusive), through the BOIS DE LAHORVILLE, DOMPIERRE (exclusive), DOMMARTIN (inclusive), HERBEUVILLE (exclusive), COMBRES (inclusive).
It is reported that at 3.45 a.m. this morning our troops have reached VIGNEULLES from the western flank of the salient.
The number of prisoners reported taken last night was 9,500 and 60 guns have been captured.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
13th September, 1918.
Issued at 12.40 p.m.
